memory_verse.label: Memory Verse
memory_verse.text: “Be shepherds of God’s flock that is under your care, watching over them not lording it over those entrusted to you, but being examples to the flock.” – (1 Peter 5:2–3)

devotion.label: Insight / Reflection
devotion.text:
Spiritual life grows only through proper care. Just as a plant needs water, fertilizer, and a fence for protection, our soul grows through prayer, ministry, and encouragement. Paul planted, Apollos watered, but God gave the increase. We may nurture, but it is God alone who brings growth.
Eli’s sons failed to care for God’s people; instead, they frightened them. The people grew weary of offering sacrifices and drifted away. Likewise, King Rehoboam lost unity in his kingdom because he chose to threaten his people with whips and scorpions instead of caring for them. Where there is no care, growth stops, division begins, and strength fades away.
Paul testified, “We were gentle among you, like a mother caring for her little children.” May the Lord raise such loving and prayerful shepherds in these days, leaders with a mother’s heart. It is caring, not scaring, that builds the Kingdom of God.
“True growth happens where love leads and prayer waters.”

quote.label: Today's Quote
quote.text: “The true shepherd tends and feeds the sheep; he never frightens them.” – Charles Spurgeon

prayer.label: Prayer
prayer.text: Lord, teach me to care with the heart of a shepherd. Remove every trace of harshness. Help me to nurture souls with love and prayer. Let me not be one who scares, but one who truly cares. Amen.

conclusion.label: A Word to You
text: May the Lord’s compassion be revealed through your care.
Let your love become the instrument that lifts others higher.
